Playfully teases Leonard about his slow speed on the treadmill and calorie burning.
Engages in a lighthearted, teasing exchange with Kassie about qualities in a donor and the idea of getting a dog.
Laughs and shakes his head when Kassie suggests getting a Portuguese water dog, politely rejecting the idea.
Pulls Kassie away to talk privately, tries to warn her about Sandy being a bad influence.
Accurately describes Kassie's drunkenness and expresses concern about her behavior.
Shows jealousy and hostility toward Sandy, repeatedly disparages him.
Responds negatively with a scowl, distanced from the party’s fun, aligns with Artie in dislike of Sandy.
Warns Sandy about Kassie's plans and hands him the address to meet her, facilitating a potentially important connection.
Calls Kassie a 'freak show' but acknowledges she is great in bed and interested in Sandy, showing a blunt yet honest attitude toward others.
Locks Kassie out of the party by locking the door, ignoring her banging and calls for help.
Sends Sandy to Harlem to intervene in Kassie's situation without her consent, showing a controlling behavior despite Kassie's objections.
Urges Kassie not to have a child because it will change their relationship and hurt him, showing genuine pain and vulnerability.
Insists that Kassie shouldn't do what she wants just because he thinks he is right, expressing control and lack of respect for her autonomy.
When Kassie tells him she is pregnant, he listens quietly, appears shocked and emotional, and says he is happy for her.
Upon learning Kassie is moving away, he becomes almost tearful, honestly expresses feeling shattered, and reflects thoughtfully about the wellbeing of the child.
Engages in a sincere and tender moment with Kassie, expressing that he will miss her and showing vulnerability.
Excitedly greets Sebastian and Kassie with gifts after two years apart, smiles warmly at Sebastian.
Snaps back abruptly when introducing Pauline, causing Kassie to feel taken off guard and upset.
Explains evolution patiently to Sebastian and shares a joke with him, looking at him with easy loving eyes.
Ignores Sebastian's direct question about his own health fears and continues his explanation instead of engaging.
Brings up the topic of Sebastian's father gently but pushes for information as Sebastian retreats inwardly.
Does not push Sebastian when he retreats and shows sensitivity to his emotional state.
Reassures Sebastian confidently that he does not have Parkinson’s disease despite Sebastian’s fears.
Listens attentively to Sebastian, showing patience and engagement in their interaction.
Observes and processes the situation quietly when Kassie and Sebastian reunite, showing awareness and emotional intelligence.
Expresses uncertainty about his relationship with Kassie, indicating some self-awareness and realistic perspective.
Handles praise gracefully and holds confident eye contact with Kassie.
Throws a variety of toys and items into the cart impulsively while on a break from work, seemingly ignoring the practical situation.
Engages in an elaborate, intelligent-sounding discussion about evolutionary biology (honeybee and salamander strategies) to justify his behavior and choices.
Smiles patiently and confidently when interacting with the clerk, handing over his credit card without hesitation.
Admits openly to having always given in to his emotions and 'gotten away with it,' acknowledging a lack of self-control or planning.
Shows some self-awareness and attempts to frame his impulsive behavior within a broader evolutionary context, indicating some intelligence and reflective capacity.
Tries to engage in a serious emotional conversation, but shows insecurity and confusion, unable to clearly express his feelings.
Attempts to correct Kassie's insult quickly and wittily, demonstrating quick thinking.
Storms off angrily instead of addressing the situation calmly, showing lack of emotional control.
Eventually stops and faces Kassie, showing willingness to confront rather than avoid.
Listens nervously and responds sincerely to Kassie’s praise and vulnerability.
Grabs Kassie and kisses her long, hard, and explosively; shares a vulnerable and sincere moment.
Acknowledges his insecurities openly and laughs them off, showing self-acceptance.
Decides to end his current relationship upon reconnecting with Kassie, showing commitment to sincerity.
Explains complex economic concepts like supply and demand clearly and confidently to Sebastian, using relatable examples.
Acknowledges Nahra's compliment about Sebastian without defensiveness, showing confidence in his own parenting.
Does not shy away from teaching and engaging with Sebastian, demonstrating patience and skill in communication.
Encourages Sebastian by highlighting his positive traits like humor and intelligence despite his concerns about being short.
Acknowledges the harsh reality about women possibly not loving Sebastian because of his height but does so with quiet sadness, showing empathy.
Initially dismisses Kassie's attempt to talk privately about a personal and sensitive issue by focusing on work, showing insensitivity.
Eventually agrees to speak privately with Kassie, indicating some willingness to engage beyond work matters.
Explains harsh realities to Kassie about their child's future, sharing his protective concerns based on his own experiences.
Dismisses Kassie's feelings and accuses her of hypocrisy, showing little empathy.
Remains calm and quiet when Kassie accuses him of having no right and leaving, showing restraint.
Buzzes Kassie in with tentative reaction, indicating cautious openness.
Calmly asks about Roland with no edge, showing measured respect despite difficulty.
Expresses he is crushed but happy for Kassie, demonstrating sincere goodwill despite personal pain.
Refuses to kiss Kassie and shuts down her attempt to rekindle relationship, responding coldly and with distance.
Wally shows determination and urgency to leave and do something important despite social obligations and distractions.
Leans down next to Kassie at her engagement party to talk to her, indicating a desire for sincere communication.
Insists on confessing feelings at Kassie and Roland’s engagement party despite social awkwardness and rejection.
Tries to get a toast at the party but is ignored and dismissed by Kassie.
